page.title: 16Transport - Delivering glass
page.content: Glass is hard to{transport}because it is{dangerous,fragile}and{heavy.}It is so sharp that it could cut a lorry cab in two. Glass has to be kept{dry}at all times otherwise the sheets cannot be seperated, so they use{canvas}or{ {polythene}sheeting. The glass is transported to warehouses of glass merchants, who off load the glass usually by mechanical means although sometimes by hand with men using {suction pads.}The latest idea of transporting glass is by a{floatliner. This new type of lorry has air suspention which enables the lorry to raise or lower itself to pick up its own heavy load. The most popular glass carried is{float glass.}The sheets of glass are made into standard size packs. These packs are then lifted on to an{"A"frame}grab suspended by a crane.
